intro: Pauletia forficata var. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered pauletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically hairy stems. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions and well-drained soil. Its foliage is often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinct botanical appearance.
